physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
Standard:
4 Rounds:
- 10 Deadlifts (light–moderate)
- 8 Burpees
- :20 Plank Hold

Bodyweight:
4 Rounds:
- 12 Good Mornings (2-1-1)
- 8 Burpees
- :20 Plank Hold
neurological: Stand on one leg for 45s each side — stability is a core pillar of healthy aging.
cognitive: Set one clear task and repeat it after 10 seconds — small working-memory training.
emotional: Do 5 rounds of 4–4 breathing and rate tension before/after — emotional regulation improves longevity.
lifestyle: Drink 300 ml water before coffee — early hydration supports metabolic stability.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
Standard:
AMRAP 12:
- 5 Neutral-Grip Pull-Ups
- 10 Push-Ups

Bodyweight:
AMRAP 12:
- 6 Table Rows
- 10 Push-Ups
neurological: Walk heel-to-toe for 20 controlled steps — gait precision maintains neurological resilience.
cognitive: Do one task for 3 minutes with your phone away — focused attention protects cognitive aging.
emotional: Take 5 slow breaths and name the physical sensation you feel — labeling reduces stress load.
lifestyle: Add one protein source to breakfast — supports muscle retention across lifespan.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version:
3 Rounds:
- :45 Sit-Ups
- :45 Walking Lunges
- :45 Bear Crawl
- :45 Rest
neurological: Reach arms up/down a wall 10× — shoulder mechanics maintain movement longevity.
cognitive: Write one sentence about something that went well — positive recall strengthens cognitive resilience.
emotional: Breathe slowly for 2 minutes and feel your heartbeat — interoception reduces stress chemistry.
lifestyle: Get 5 minutes of morning light — anchors circadian rhythm for better sleep and repair.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
Standard:
EMOM 12:
- :30 Jump Rope
- :30 Rest

Bodyweight:
EMOM 12:
- :30 Fast March / Run in Place
- :30 Rest
neurological: Step up a stair 10× with full-foot pressure — supports leg strength needed for late-life independence.
cognitive: Recall one moment that made you smile today — emotional memory training protects cognition.
emotional: Smile gently and take one long exhale — small state shifts improve stress recovery.
lifestyle: Add a colorful fruit/vegetable today — micronutrients support long-term metabolic health.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version:
12-minute steady walk, nasal breathing, easy pace.
neurological: Turn head side-to-side 5× — cervical mobility supports balance and fall-prevention.
cognitive: Count 10 slow breaths without losing focus — sustained attention protects aging brain.
emotional: Walk slowly for 5 minutes and notice tension dropping — awareness improves regulation.
lifestyle: Sit outside 5 minutes without screens — environmental light calibrates circadian biology.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version:
EMOM 12:
- :40 Burpees
- :20 Rest
neurological: Move shoulders in slow circles 10× — maintaining joint control reduces long-term injury risk.
cognitive: Think of one kind act you did this week — prosocial recall strengthens cognitive-emotional networks.
emotional: Close eyes and breathe 2 minutes with long exhale — lengthening exhale reduces sympathetic drive.
lifestyle: Stretch your back for 1 minute before bed — small mobility inputs improves sleep quality.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version:
3 Rounds:
- :30 Wall Sit
- :30 Hollow Hold
- :30 Side Plank (L)
- :30 Side Plank (R)
- :30 Rest
neurological: Balance on one foot 30s per side — single-leg control predicts later-life functional capacity.
cognitive: State one clear goal and repeat it once — reinforces intentional action circuitry.
emotional: Take 5 deep breaths with long exhales — calming the system improves emotional durability.
lifestyle: Eat a full meal with vegetables post-training — improves metabolic recovery.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
Standard:
AMRAP 12:
- 4 SA Deadlifts / side
- 3 SA Hang Cleans / side
- 2 SA Shoulder-to-Overhead / side

Bodyweight:
AMRAP 12:
- 6 Single-Leg Hip Hinge / side
- 4 Tempo Good Mornings
- 4 Push-Ups
neurological: Reach arms overhead/down 10× — upper-body mobility protects long-term movement freedom.
cognitive: Write one line about what challenged you — cognitive appraisal improves resilience.
emotional: Sit quietly 1 minute and notice heart rate slowing — recovery capacity predicts longevity.
lifestyle: Take a short walk after lunch — post-meal movement reduces glucose spikes.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version:
12-minute brisk walk, tall posture, nasal breathing.
neurological: Stand tall with eyes closed 30s — balance training supports fall-risk reduction.
cognitive: Say one thing you learned this week — continuous learning protects cognitive longevity.
emotional: Inhale 5s / exhale 5s for 6 rounds — even breathing tones the nervous system.
lifestyle: Turn off screens 30 minutes before bed — improves melatonin release and sleep architecture.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
Standard:
AMRAP 12:
- 4 Goblet Lunges
- 2 Lateral Burpees
- 1 Strict Pull-Up
- 10 m Bottom-Up Carry / arm

Bodyweight:
AMRAP 12:
- 6 Reverse Lunges
- 2 Lateral Burpees
- 3 Inverted Rows
- :15 OA Overhead Balance Hold / side
neurological: Stand on one foot 30s per side — balance under fatigue trains neurological durability.
cognitive: Say your plan for tomorrow out loud — proactive intention improves cognitive clarity.
emotional: Lie down and breathe slow for 2 minutes — down-regulating after exertion improves recovery quality.
lifestyle: Drink one glass of water before each meal — supports appetite and metabolic control.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version:
AMRAP 12:
- 10 Push-Ups
- 15 Air Squats
neurological: Stand on one leg, eyes closed 45s — eyes-closed stability trains vestibular health.
cognitive: Set one intention for today and state it clearly — intentional clarity supports executive function.
emotional: Box breathe 4-4-4-4 for 2 minutes — controlled breath regulates stress pathways.
lifestyle: Drink ½ liter water before coffee — early hydration supports cardiovascular stability.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version (Water):
12-minute easy swim or water walk

Land Alternative:
12-minute easy cardio flow:
- 1 min walk
- 1 min slow air squats (repeat 6×)
neurological: Walk heel-to-toe for 20 steps — coordinated gait helps preserve neurological function.
cognitive: Do one task only for 3 minutes — monotasking strengthens focus circuitry.
emotional: Exhale 6s / inhale 4s ×10 — extended exhale shifts the nervous system parasympathetic.
lifestyle: Add ~20 g protein to breakfast — anchors muscle-protective habits.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version:
2 Rounds:
- 1:00 Cat–Cow
- :30 Slow Scap Circles
- :45 Suitcase March (no load)
- :30 Reverse Wrist Curl / side
- :30 Open Book / side
neurological: Stand to sit without hands ×6 — lower-body strength predicts late-life independence.
cognitive: Write one line: “What matters most today?” — prioritization supports cognitive clarity.
emotional: Sit still 2 minutes noticing breath/heartbeat — interoception improves emotional steadiness.
lifestyle: Take a 10-minute walk after your main meal — enhances glucose control.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version:
12-minute brisk walk (ruck optional).
neurological: Do 12 calf raises per side — ankle strength supports lifelong mobility.
cognitive: Notice one distraction pattern and name it — naming reduces cognitive drift.
emotional: Finish with a 30s cool rinse — cold exposure improves stress tolerance.
lifestyle: Add one colorful plant food to a meal — nutrient density supports long-term health.

physical:
OMNIFIT SHORTS (12 min)
One Version:
EMOM 12:
1) :40 Tempo Squats (3-1-1-0)
2) :15 SA Plank Hold (switch at :15)
3) :30 Russian Twists
neurological: Do dead bug 3×6 slow per side — core control is foundational for spine longevity.
cognitive: Read your plan once and follow it exactly — executing the plan trains cognitive discipline.
emotional: Breathe quietly for 2 minutes and relax your jaw — muscle relaxation reduces nervous-system load.
lifestyle: Get 5 minutes of morning light — anchors your circadian rhythm for the day.
